records.full_caption: Figure 1. Comparison of Eox acquired via DPV for polymers ProDOT-Ph, ProDOT-Fl, ProDOT-Cbz, and ProDOT2-Ph. Current has been normalized. Reference: 74 mV vs Fe/Fe+.
records.caption: Comparison of Eox acquired via DPV for polymers ProDOT-Ph, ProDOT-Fl, ProDOT-Cbz, and ProDOT2-Ph.

records.full_caption: Figure 2. Normalized UV−vis−NIR spectra of polymer solutions in chlorobenzene. Concentrations of solutions for spectra range from 0.05 to 0.02 mg/mL. Photographs of polymer solutions are inset and numbered: (A) ProDOT-Ph (1), ProDOT-F (2), ProDOT-Cbz (3), and ProDOT-Ph(MeO)2 (4). (B) R-ProDOT-Ph/Ph(MeO)2 (5), ProDOT-Py (6), ProDOT-Py(Ph)2 (7) and ProDOT-Py2 (8).
records.caption: Figure 2. Normalized UV−vis−NIR spectra of polymer solutions in chlorobenzene. Concentrations of solutions for spectra range from 0.05 to 0.02 mg/mL. Photographs of polymer solutions are inset and numbered: (A) ProDOT-Ph (1), ProDOT-F (2), ProDOT-Cbz (3), and ProDOT-Ph(MeO)2 (4). (B) R-ProDOT-Ph/Ph(MeO)2 (5), ProDOT-Py (6), ProDOT-Py(Ph)2 (7) and ProDOT-Py2 (8).

records.full_caption: Figure 5. Comparison between the transmittance (%) of the neutral and oxidized forms of ProDOT-Ph, ProDOT-Cbz, and R-ProDOT-Ph(PhMeO)2. Films were sprayed to an absorbance of ∼1.0 (A) ProDOT-Ph at 0 mV, (B) ProDOT-Ph at 1150 mV, (C) ProDOT-Cbz at 0 mV, (D) ProDOT-Cbz at 1100 mV, (E) R-ProDOT-Ph(PhMeO)2 at 0 mV, and (F) R-ProDOT-Ph(PhMeO)2 at 950 mV.
records.caption: ProDOT-Ph at 0 mV

records.full_caption: Figure 3. Normalized neutral state spectra of cast polymer films on ITO-coated glass in 0.2 M LiBTI/PC electrolyte solution: (A) ProDOT-Ph, ProDOT-Fl, ProDOT-Cbz, and ProDOT-Ph(PhMeO)2; (B) R-ProDOT-Ph(PhMeO)2, ProDOT-Py, ProDOT-T2, and ProDOT-Ph.
records.caption: ProDOT-Ph, ProDOT-Fl, ProDOT-Cbz, and ProDOT-Ph(PhMeO)2

records.full_caption: Figure 6. Chronoabsorptometry of ProDOT-Cbz measured at 445 nm from 0 to 1100 mV in an electrolyte solution.
records.caption: Chronoabsorptometry of ProDOT-Cbz measured at 445 nm from 0 to 1100 mV in an electrolyte solution.

records.full_caption: Figure 7. Colorimetry a* b* (CIE 1976 L* a* b* Color Space) color coordinates of a thin film of ProDOT-Cbz taken as a function of level of electrochemical oxidation (0−1100 mV, 50 mV steps). The film shown possesses an optical density of 0.8 au at 445 nm.

Figure 7. Colorimetry a* b* (CIE 1976 L* a* b* Color Space) color coordinates of a thin film of ProDOT-Cbz taken as a function of level of electrochemical oxidation (0−1100 mV, 50 mV steps). The film shown possesses an optical density of 0.8 au at 445 nm.
Figure 8. Absorption spectra of ProDOT-Ph in the neutral (0 mV), intermediate (750 mV), and fully oxidized (1100 mV) states. CIE standard observers 2°, 10°, and 2° are overlaid.
records.caption: Figure 8. Absorption spectra of ProDOT-Ph in the neutral (0 mV), intermediate (750 mV), and fully oxidized (1100 mV) states. CIE standard observers 2°, 10°, and 2° are overlaid.

records.full_caption: Figure 10. Photographic comparison between ProDOT-Ph (left), ProDOT-Cl2 (middle), and R-ProDOT-Ph/Ph(MeO)2 (right). All three polymers were spray cast using a mask (~1 cm) onto a single sheet of ITO-coated glass using a clean piece of ITO-coated glass of equal size as a counter electrode.
records.caption: Photographic comparison between ProDOT-Ph (left), ProDOT-Cl2 (middle), and R-ProDOT-Ph/Ph(MeO)2 (right).

records.full_caption: Figure 10. Photographic comparison between ProDOT-Ph (left), ProDOT-Cl2 (middle), and R-ProDOT-Ph/Ph(MeO)2 (right). All three polymers were spray cast using a mask (~1 cm) onto a single sheet of ITO-coated glass using a clean piece of ITO-coated glass of equal size as a counter electrode.
records.caption: All three polymers were spray cast using a mask (~1 cm) onto a single sheet of ITO-coated glass using a clean piece of ITO-coated glass of equal size as a counter electrode.

records.full_caption: Figure 9. Colorimetry of all polymers with initial neutral state optical density of ~0.8 with the exception of ProDOT-Py and ProDOT2-Py (optical density of ~1.0). Squares represent neutral states, and circles represent the most oxidized states. ProDOT-Ph (black), ProDOT-F1 (red), ProDOT-OEt (green), ProDOT-Th(MeO)2 (blue), R-ProDOT-Ph/Ph(MeO)2 (orange), ProDOT2-Ph (pink), ProDOT-Py (brown), and ProDOT2-Py (dark cyan).
records.caption: Figure 9. Colorimetry of all polymers with initial neutral state optical density of ~0.8 with the exception of ProDOT-Py and ProDOT2-Py (optical density of ~1.0). Squares represent neutral states, and circles represent the most oxidized states. ProDOT-Ph (black), ProDOT-F1 (red), ProDOT-OEt (green), ProDOT-Th(MeO)2 (blue), R-ProDOT-Ph/Ph(MeO)2 (orange), ProDOT2-Ph (pink), ProDOT-Py (brown), and ProDOT2-Py (dark cyan).
